sentences.en: And more than 10 million are afflicted by fluorosis, which can soften and disfigure teeth and bones.
sentences.cn: 此外,贵州还有超过1000万人有氟中毒的症状, 导致牙齿、骼软化与变形.

sentences.en: His face had been disfigured in an accident.
sentences.cn: 在一次意外事故中他毁了容。

sentences.en: Now , all the prejudices of the Restoration , all its interests, all its instincts tended disfigure Napoleon.
sentences.cn: 复辟王朝的所有偏见、利益 、 本性, 都使人歪曲拿破仑的形象.

sentences.en: To mar is to injure or damage; to spoil disfigure, or impair.
sentences.cn: 损害, 就是伤害或毁坏 、 破坏、使之变形或削弱.

sentences.en: To mutilate or disfigure by battering, hacking, cutting, or tearing.
sentences.cn: 乱切,乱打用击打 、 压 、 切或撕的方式使残缺不全或形状破损.

sentences.en: Wind turbines are large and noisy and they disfigure the landscape.
sentences.cn: 风力涡轮机个头大、噪音响，还会破坏周边风景。

words.tran_cn: 损毁…的外形；损害（disfigure的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 损毁…的外形； 使变丑
trans.tran_en: to spoil the appearance that something naturally has

trans.tran_cn: 损毁…的外形，使变丑，损毁
trans.tran_en: to spoil the appearance that something naturally has
